intro: Ilex leucantha, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by red berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans. Ilex leucantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and year-round visual interest. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings.
